The idea of hashing
If one wants to store a certain set of similar objects and want to quickly access a given one (or come back with the result that it is unknown), the first idea would be to store them in a list, possibly sorted for faster access. This however still would need \log(n) comparisons to access a given element.
Therefore one uses a much bigger array and uses a function on the space of possible objects with integer values to decide, where in the array to store a certain object. If this so called hash function distributes the actually stored objects well enough over the array, in average the access time is contant.
